summary: The COVID-19 pandemic forced the Census Bureau to delay its 2020 operations. But in August, the Bureau announced it will deliver apportionment data by December as required. The Bureau faces compressed timeframes, untested procedures, and public safety challenges to do so. To ensure a complete, accurate census, the Bureau must focus on (among other things): hiring and retaining enough staff to follow up with people...
title: 2020 Census: Recent Decision to Compress Census Timeframes Poses Additional Risks to an Accurate Count
